title: Microsoft Publisher 2013 for Beginners - Create Beautiful Publications
headline: Learn how to create flyers, posters and newsletters with this free online Microsoft Publisher beginners course.
description: This free online Microsoft Publisher 2013 beginners training course will teach you about how you can create beautiful presentations. In this course you will study how to create a new publication, use the Backstage View, and insert, move, rename and delete pages, as well as how to view and navigate pages, use rulers, and guidelines in creating a new publication as well as configure business information, customize setting preferences, and more!

courseDescription:
Event invitations, holiday cards, brochures, and flyers are all a snap when you discover the tricks of high-end desktop publishing in our  Microsoft Publisher 2013 course. In this video training course, you’ll get the tools you need to add your unique touch of creativity to any kind of document.

The course starts with your expert instructor helping you explore the Publisher interface and get comfortable with navigating your way around it. Next, you’ll discover how to delete and add pages, and how to move pages around when you want to change your document’s order. Instructional videos on paragraph formatting, working with columns, and using fonts will then teach you to make an impact with your text. You’ll learn to work with Styles and to work with images, including Bitmap and Vector images.

If you’re interested in graphic design as a future career, or if you’re a design professional looking for new skills, then this clear and simple course is the one for you. Working with page styles and formatting images are essential tasks for any designer, so learning how to perform these tasks with confidence is an absolute must for any aspiring graphic designer. So, start this free online class and by the time the class is completed, you’ll have mastered the process of preparing your Publisher project for professional printing or for publication on the Web.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about acquiring Microsoft Publisher 2013, and topic such as creating a new publication, and using the Backstage View in Microsoft Publisher 2013.
topics: Insert, Move, Rename and Delete Pages

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about inserting and formatting text boxes in Microsoft Publisher 2013, and topics such as working with font schemes, importing text from work, and setting paragraph and line spacing options.
topics: Setting Paragraph and Line Spacing Options

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you'll learn about the differences between Bitmap and Vector images, and topics such as how to insert images and image placeholders, and how to move, resize and crop images.
topics: Working with Images and Graphics - Learning Outcomes
Adding Captions and Alternate Text to Images
Inserting Page Parts, Borders and Accents
Working with Images and Graphics - Lesson Summary

    • Outline how to configure business information in Microsoft Publisher 2013. 
    • Identify how to customize setting preferences in Microsoft Publisher 2013.
    • Discuss how to successfully save your publication.
